amendment.description: An amendment numbered 44 printed in Part B of House Report 118-535 to increase and decrease funding by $10 million to conduct a study on the benefits of utilizing artificial intelligence (AI) to streamline oversight, mitigate and reduce fraud, and improve data accuracy and financial management practices at the Department of Veterans Affairs.
amendment.purpose: Amendment increases and decreases funding by $10 million to conduct a study on the benefits of utilizing artificial intelligence (AI) to streamline oversight, mitigate and reduce fraud, and improve data accuracy and financial management practices at the Department of Veterans Affairs.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment (A029) Agreed to by recorded vote: 392 - 11 (Roll no. 244).

action.text: Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Schweikert amendment (A029) Agreed to by recorded vote: 392 - 11 (Roll no. 244).
